entry.title: ROSEBURG WITH RECORD BREAKING HIGH ON SUNDAY
entry.summary: October 9, 2023 4:10 a.m. A warm weekend wrapped up with a record breaking high for the date in the Umpqua Valley on Sunday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 88 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record for October 8th...

entry.title: COLUMBUS DAY/INDIGENOUS PEOPLES DAY MONDAY
entry.summary: October 9, 2023 4:00 a.m. Monday is observed as Columbus Day nationally and all federal offices are closed. Regular mail will not be delivered. Some banks and credit unions will not be open. The State of Oregon recognizes the day as Indigenous People’s Day, though state government offices remain open. Oregon has nine federally recognized...

entry.title: CITY COUNCIL TO CONSIDER CITY MAANGERS EMERGENCY CONTRACT AWARD
entry.summary: October 9, 2023 3:40 a.m. The Roseburg City Council will consider the city manager’s report of emergency action and a related contract award at its meeting Monday night at 7:00 p.m. City Manager Nikki Messenger recently awarded a contract for consultant services for the annexation of Sunshine Park into the city limits under what she...

entry.title: APPLICANTS NEEDED FOR COUNTY PLANNING COMMISSION
entry.summary: October 9.2023 3:30 a.m. The Douglas County Board of Commissioners is accepting applications for volunteer representatives on the Douglas County Planning Commission. The commission is a seven-member advisory and decision-making body within county government. Members represent differing interests, geographic areas and occupations. The term of appointment is four years. The commission advises the county on...

entry.title: ROSEBURG VA MEDICAL CENTER OFFERING FALL VACCINE CLINICS
entry.summary: October 9, 2023 3:20 a.m. The Roseburg VA Medical Center has its fall vaccine clinics underway. *A walk-in flu vaccine clinic is being held on Fridays from 9:00 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. and from 1:00 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. It will be on the first floor of Building 1. *A drive-thru flu and COVID-19 vaccine...

entry.title: 8TH ANNUAL ZONTA DIGNITY DRIVE UNDERWAY
entry.summary: October 9, 2023 3:00 a.m. October is Domestic Abuse Awareness Month and the Zonta Club of Roseburg has its 8th annual Zonta Dignity Drive underway. A Zonta release said victims of violence are often forced to flee their home with little more than the clothing they are wearing. Residents can help restore the dignity of...

entry.title: County seeking applications for Douglas County Planning Commission
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Applicants are being sought from those who want to serve a four-year term on the seven-member planning commission.

entry.title: Blocktomber Fest fills downtown
entry.summary: The Second Annual Blocktober Fest joined forces with Umpqua Brew Fest and the Hesh Moto Show on Saturday, taking over downtown Roseburg and drawing a crowd from all walks of life.

entry.title: Watch the eclipse, stay safe
entry.summary: The world as we know it will become only slightly dark for about four minutes and 20 seconds beginning at 9:16 a.m. next Saturday in Roseburg and other parts of Douglas County.

entry.title: Ring of Fire solar eclipse
entry.summary: About once every year or two, the moon aligns to cover most or all of the sun, producing a solar eclipse. This Oct. 14, the new moon will cover about 91% of the apparent diameter of the sun.

entry.title: Western Oregon University summer honor roll
entry.summary: MONMOUTH — Western Oregon University announced the undergraduate students that have been named to the honor roll and President’s list for academic honors for summer 2023.

entry.title: South Umpqua hosts meet-and-greet with first responders
entry.summary: TRI CITY — South Umpqua High School played host Wednesday to representatives from local law enforcement and public safety agencies, who arrived to meet and greet with students and parents.

entry.title: GOVERNOR ORDERS FLAGS TO HALF-STAFF IN REMEMBRANCE OF AIRMAN TRINITY REINHART
entry.summary: October 6, 2023 10:40 a.m. On Friday, Governor Tina Kotek ordered flags at Oregon public institutions to be flown at half-staff in honor and remembrance of Air Force Airman Trinity Reinhart. The flag should be flown at half-staff until sunset on the day of Airman Reinhart’s memorial on Saturday. Kotek said, “I send my condolences...

entry.title: Adapt awarded nearly $7 million state grant for new facility
entry.summary: Adapt Integrated Health Care, the leading provider of mental health care and substance abuse treatment in the region, was awarded nearly $7 million by the state to build a residential treatment facility in Roseburg.

entry.title: Adventures of Molly: Newspaper subscriber chronicles dog's fun
entry.summary: The News-Review may have discovered its youngest fan yet — she is 11 months old, has four legs, loves belly rubs and will do anything for a delicious treat.

entry.title: Kids play in dirt, pet animals for Ag Day
entry.summary: Students from three local elementary schools gathered in the crisp beginning-of-fall weather of early October on Thursday to explore all things agriculture during Douglas County Ag Day, hosted by the Douglas County Farm Bureau.

entry.title: GOVERNOR ORDERS RETURN OF FLAGS TO FULL-STAFF
entry.summary: October 6, 2023 4:00 a.m. Pursuant to a Presidential Proclamation, Governor Tina Kotek ordered flags at Oregon public institutions to be returned to full-staff, as of sunset on Thursday. This follows U.S. Senator Dianne Feinstein’s funeral and internment. The Presidential Proclamation can be found: https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2023/09/29/
